item.title: Rubbish dumped on Little Newport Street, 18th August
item.description:
There is a vast majority of rubbish littered in this area, including bin bags which leads to more people throwing there rubbish here as they assume that the spot is a rubbish bin. Furthermore, there are some bin bags thrown into this area which then resulted to people slipping from the leakage of oil through the piles of rubbish in this area as me being the witness. This has been a serious concern in this specific area as I do believe that the slip hazard is really dangerous in this area. Also, the stack of rubbish is disturbing our customers of the pungent smell outside our store and it is giving a bad reputation to our company. Please may you sort this problem out as fast as you can so that Westminster can be a better community. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Little Newport Street, Chinatown, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane on Westminster Bridge (north to south) is routinely obstructed by illegally parked ice cream vans and Tuk Tuks, causing tourists to spill into the lane and forcing cyclists into traffic. No enforcement or physical barrier exists to prevent this., 18th August
item.description:
The north-to-south cycle lane on Westminster Bridge is consistently compromised by ice cream vans and Tuk Tuks parked illegally on double red lines. These vehicles attract large crowds of tourists who queue directly in the cycle lane, often including young children unaware they are standing in a live traffic zone. This forces cyclists into the main carriageway, placing them in direct conflict with buses and vehicles. Despite the clear traffic violations, there is no enforcement. Police are frequently present but do not intervene, allowing this behaviour to continue unchecked. The absence of any physical barrier between the cycle lane and pedestrian walkway enables constant encroachment, especially from tourists taking photos of nearby landmarks such as Big Ben and the Palace of Westminster. I have included a selection of photos to document the issue taken on 31 July 2025, showing. This is a serious public safety issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westminster Bridge, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need pruning - overgrown onto pavement and blocking signs, 18th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
